Description: The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission issued an Order filing and settling charges against Davisco Foods International, Inc., based in Le Sueur, Minnesota, for failure to register with the CFTC as a Futures Commission Merchant.
Info Source: http://www.cftc.gov/PressRoom/PressReleases/pr7539-17

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Jerome Cheese, a division of Minnesota-based Davisco Foods International, Inc., has reached a settlement with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency for failing to comply of federal Clean Air Act Risk Management Plan regulations aimed at preventing chemical accidents. The violations occurred at the Jerome Cheese manufacturing facility in Jerome, Idaho. The settlement includes a monetary penalty of $88,000.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/004dda6ce131de3d85257d74005894f3.html
Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
